CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 5, 1955, page 15, reads: "Church-Going Profitable For This Lady - When the lady whose face The Courier artists have ringed went to Baptist Temple Church, corner of Race and Sterrit Streets Sunday, she expected to profit from the sermon. In addition, she will profit from having been in the crowd leaving the church which was snapped by Courier Photographer Charles (Teenie) Harris.  There is a $5 award awaiting the person whose picture is ringed in a crowd photo taken some place in Western Pennsylvania each week.  It may be at a church or it may be at some other gathering.  Wherever the crowd is, The Courier photographers and reporters are usually there.  Last week's winner was Walter Lucas of 40-E Midway Drive, Whitaker."
TitMainTitle: Crowd of men and women, including one wearing fur coat and hat with feather, standing on sidewalk in front of Baptist Temple Church, corner of Race and Sterrit Streets
